Hi Noah,

My requirement is that if there are 10 links on one page, then I =
want that those 10 links should be crawled in ascending(or descending, rand=
om) order as they occur in the parent page.
How can this be possible? Is it=
 feasible to modify the UriPrecedencePolicy and other classes?
I am new to =
this, so it will require a lot of time.

Regards,
Nikhil

--- In archive-cr=
awler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:
>
> Hey,
> 
> As I =
mentioned previously, you can create a custom implementation of
> UriPreced=
encePolicy to implement your desired crawl order. You can see how
> the pre=
cedence value you generate is used in
> BdbMultipleWorkQueues.calculateInse=
rtKey(CrawlURI). Notably, the precedence
> value only accounts for one byte=
 of the insert key, so you're limited to
> 255 precedence levels. There is =
room for finer customization, but that
> would involve custom implementatio=
ns of other classes in addition to
> UriPrecedencePolicy.
> 
> But this
> m=
ight be more
>  advanced usage than you'
> re
>  comfortable with
> , espec=
ially if you didn't understand my previous emails. 
> I'm still not sure wh=
at you're trying to do, exactly. You say "crawl
> sequence/ order with Asce=
nding, Descending or Random", but what are you
> sorting by? Alphabetically=
 by url??
> 
> Noah
> 
>

system.nikhil@...>wrote:

 Heritrix for crawl sequence/ order with Ascending,

m.

able

> >

 option to Heritrix, so that it

t it maintains?
